item.title: Rural Villa in Winden Am See
item.description: Province Pannonia Province Description Location Winden Am See Winden Am See (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Winden Am See Keywords corridors rural villas vestibules villae rusticae Garden Description The modest house of this villa rustica is of the so-called corridor type, a type common in the region and already seen at Carnuntum (Fig. 1). item.title: Rural Villa in Winkel-Seeb

item.title: Rural Villa in Dietikon
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Dietikon Dietikon (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Dietikon Keywords axial plan piscinae porticoes rural villas villae rusticae Garden Description This villa rustica complex was built on a site at the bottom of a valley near and parallel to the river Limmat. item.title: Rural Villa in Bad Kreuznach

The estate was built in the second half of the 2nd century and occupied until its destruction around 275.

item.title: Rural Villa at Neerhaaren-Rekem
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Neerhaaren-Rekem Neerhaaren-Rekem (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural villa at Neerhaaren-Rekem Keywords rural villas villae rusticae arbors pergolas piscinae Garden Description The facade of this modest house of a villa rustica near the Meuse river measured 24 m. in length and had two protruding wings joined by a portico (Plan 1). The house was built in the late 1st century A.D. There is evidence for an arbor or pergola next to the house in the form of two rows of postholes arranged diagonally and converging in front of the entrance on the west (circles on plan).

item.title: Rural Villa in Latimer
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Latimer Latimer (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Latimer Keywords fences (site elements) orchards villae rusticae Garden Description Excavations at this country house in Buckinghamshire have produced evidence for gardens adjacent to the main residence in its latest phase dating to the beginning of the 4th century (Fig. 1). The house at the west is of the winged corridor type, fronted by a large courtyard bisected by a paved central drive with a banked edge.

item.title: Rural Villa in Chedworth
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Chedworth Chedworth (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Chedworth Keywords bathhouses (water recreation structures) mosaics (visual works) sherds villae rusticae Garden Description This Roman villa in Gloucestershire was partially excavated in the late 19th century, but only the built features and their mosaic floors appear to have been of interest to the Victorian diggers. Excavations in the courtyard conducted between 2000 and 2002 revealed that earlier excavators had not disturbed the courtyard.
